raw_comment:
1) The acceptance rate for legacy applicants is higher than applicants without legacy status, especially for the top 0.1% who are 7x more likely to be accepted. 
2) Why does the acceptance rate for applicants without legacy status drop below the average? Why is the boost for the top 0.1% so high? 
3) As a high school student who will be the first in my family to attend college, I find it interesting to see other applicants' advantages over me. Even though the graph compares students with the same test scores, students who come from wealthy families have the upper hand over everyone else. 
4) Your Dream College Wants Daddy's Money, Not You
